</div>

</div>
              <div class="field__item">            <div class="paragraph__wysiwyg-text">
        <div class="content__wrapper">
    <div class="body-text  "><h2>What's happening in DR Congo?</h2><div class="text--with-red-top-divider">&nbsp;</div><p>Eastern Democratic Republic of Congo has been the site of a decades-long protracted conflict, with armed groups fighting to access and control its natural resources like gold, copper, lithium, and oil. Civilians have been caught in between, facing attacks, repeated displacement, and increasingly dire conditions in camps, particularly around Goma, the capital of North Kivu province.&nbsp;</p></div>
</div>
      </div>
      </div>
              <div class="field__item">
	
		
		
	
	<div class="paragraph paragraph--type--accordion paragraph--view-mode--default">
					
<div class="msf-accordion accordion-container content__wrapper">
  
      <div class="ac ">
  <h3 class="ac-header">
    <button class="ac-trigger"><h3>Conflict is resurging in the east, reaching Goma</h3></button>
          <p class="ac-preview-content"> Since January 2025, fighting between M23/AFC (Alliance Fleuve Congo), the Congolese army, and their respective allies has escalated.  </p>
      </h3>
  <div class="ac-panel">
    
    
  <div class="field field--name-field-accordion-content-block field--type-entity-reference-revisions field--label-hidden field__items">
        <div class="field__item">            <div class="paragraph__wysiwyg-text">
        <div class="content__wrapper">
    <div class="body-text  "><p>Since January 2025, fighting between M23/AFC (Alliance Fleuve Congo), the Congolese army, and their respective allies has escalated. M23 has been progressively taking over territory in eastern DRC since 2022, and the fighting intensified in January 2024, causing mass casualties and displacement. The conflict has impacted people’s access to health care, food, and other basic needs, triggering mass waves of displacement and raising the risk of disease outbreaks.&nbsp;</p><h4>2025 escalation</h4><p>M23/AFC is now in control of parts of North Kivu, including Goma, and has quickly continued its advance into South Kivu, capturing the strategic towns of Kalehe and Kavumu. As a result of the fighting, many people—including those who were already displaced—are <a href="https://www.doctorswithoutborders.org/latest/dr-congo-msf-calls-dignified-and-voluntary-returns-displaced-people" title="DR Congo: MSF calls for dignified and voluntary returns for displaced people">now on the move again</a>. &nbsp;</p><p>Despite the hostilities, MSF teams continue to provide medical assistance to affected communities through regular and emergency projects in North and South Kivu. &nbsp;</p><p>Armed clashes with the M23/AFC are also taking place in other parts of North Kivu, such as Masisi and Mweso, where we are carrying out medical activities, as well as in South Kivu, where M23/AFC have also made progress in recent weeks, taking over the town of Kalehe and moving the front line to just a few kilometers away from Kavumu. Fighting in the region is ongoing and continues to trigger population movements further south.</p><h4>MSF response in Goma</h4><p>In the first days of the escalation in Goma, the fighting forced MSF to partially reduce activities in some displacement camps and temporarily withdraw some staff from several medical facilities and offices in Goma, however we continued to care for the wounded at Kyeshero Hospital. After several days of violence and looting in Goma, the situation de-escalated somewhat, allowing MSF teams to resume activities in and around Goma. These activities include:&nbsp;</p><ul><li>supporting Kyeshero and Virunga hospitals in treating wounded people;</li><li>collecting and distributing blood bags for overwhelmed hospitals;&nbsp;</li><li>returning to several displacement sites to support local health centers; expand or re-establish cholera treatment units and special clinics for survivors of sexual violence; provide food, water, and fuel for water pumping stations; and empty latrines and install hand-washing facilities. &nbsp;</li></ul><p>Priorities at this stage remain caring for the wounded and reducing the risk of cholera outbreaks, which is a concern due to unsafe water sources, inadequate sanitation, and displacement. MSF teams continue to assess humanitarian needs every day, both in the camps and in the city of Goma, as the impact on the population is enormous. The next few days will allow us to assess the next steps.&nbsp;</p></div>
</div>
      </div>
      </div>
  </div>
  </div>
</div>
      <div class="ac ">
  <h3 class="ac-header">
    <button class="ac-trigger"><h3>People are repeatedly being displaced</h3></button>
          <p class="ac-preview-content"> Over 8 million people are internally displaced across DRC, including 500,000 who have been displaced by the current fighting since January 2025.   </p>
      </h3>
  <div class="ac-panel">
    
    
  <div class="field field--name-field-accordion-content-block field--type-entity-reference-revisions field--label-hidden field__items">
        <div class="field__item">            <div class="paragraph__wysiwyg-text">
        <div class="content__wrapper">
    <div class="body-text  "><p>Over 8 million people are internally displaced across DRC, including 500,000 who have been displaced by the current fighting since January 2025. &nbsp;The situation for displaced people was already dire before the current escalation, particularly in the camps around Goma. Over the years they have grown more crowded and living conditions have deteriorated further, with severely limited access to basic needs such as proper shelter, food, water, sanitation facilities, and health care. Displaced people living in these conditions face high risk of falling ill.</p><p>For people leaving the camps, MSF is particularly concerned about the level of access to health services when they arrive in their new location. After several years of war, many health facilities have been looted or abandoned and will be unable to provide adequate medical care to those who need it, either now or in the longer term. The situation in the places people have fled is likely to be equally disastrous if NGOs, UN agencies, and authorities fail to provide the minimum level of essential services.</p><p>To ensure a minimum level of health care for displaced people in areas of return, MSF has set up mobile clinics on roads leading out of Goma to the east and the north. MSF teams are also carrying out assessments in the areas to which people are returning.</p><p>Many of the already-displaced people living in these camps are fleeing yet again, as the fighting has taken place in and around Goma. While many are returning to their places of origin—where they originally fled from—others are fleeing across the border to other countries, such as <a href="https://www.doctorswithoutborders.org/what-we-do/where-we-work/burundi" title="Burundi">Burundi</a>. That’s why, in addition to our response within DRC, MSF has <a href="https://x.com/MSF/status/1891771122338722040">sent a team</a> to Burundi’s Citiboke province to assess needs and provide emergency assistance for arriving refugees.&nbsp;</p></div>
</div>
      </div>
      </div>
        <div class="field__item">  <div class="paragraph paragraph--type--full-screen-width-image paragraph--view-mode--default">
          
                
        
  
<div class="content__wrapper full-screen__content large-image-wrapper boxed-width-container">

  <figure class="image">
        
                  <source height="893" media="all and (min-width: 1600px)" type="image/jpeg" width="1340" />
              <source height="893" media="all and (min-width: 1170px) and (max-width: 1599px)" type="image/jpeg" width="1340" />
              <source height="512" media="all and (min-width: 768px) and (max-width: 1169px)" type="image/jpeg" width="768" />
              <source height="520" media="all and (min-width: 480px) and (max-width: 767px)" type="image/jpeg" width="780" />
              <source height="410" media="all and (min-width: 320px) and (max-width: 479px)" type="image/jpeg" width="550" />
                  <img alt="The Bulengo camp for displaced people, located near Goma, DR Congo." height="893" src="https://www.doctorswithoutborders.org/sites/default/files/styles/large_image_1340_893/public/image_base_media/2025/02/MSB221764.jpg?itok=9tFVVog4" width="1340" />

  


      <div class="image__text full-screen__text">
        <span class="image__meta">
          <figcaption class="figcaption__full-width">
            The Bulengo camp for displaced people, located near Goma. <span class="caption-separator"> | </span> DR Congo 2025 ©&nbsp;Daniel Buuma
          </figcaption>
        </span>
      </div>

  </figure>
  </div>
  </div>
</div>
  </div>
  </div>
</div>
      <div class="ac ">
  <h3 class="ac-header">
    <button class="ac-trigger"><h3>Humanitarian needs are growing</h3></button>
          <p class="ac-preview-content"> The international humanitarian response has been inadequate and far too slow to meet the severity of the situation and fast-growing needs. </p>
      </h3>
  <div class="ac-panel">
    
    
  <div class="field field--name-field-accordion-content-block field--type-entity-reference-revisions field--label-hidden field__items">
        <div class="field__item">            <div class="paragraph__wysiwyg-text">
        <div class="content__wrapper">
    <div class="body-text  "><p>The humanitarian situation in eastern DRC was already dire before the current escalation. The international humanitarian response has been inadequate and far too slow to meet the severity of the situation and fast-growing needs, with underfunding, ineffective coordination, and lack of emergency preparedness in areas close to the front lines. In <a href="https://www.doctorswithoutborders.org/latest/four-questions-about-whats-going-eastern-dr-congo" title="Four questions about what’s going on in eastern DR Congo">some areas</a>, MSF has been alone in addressing medical and humanitarian needs, which far outweigh our capacity to respond. &nbsp;</p><p>Since January 2025, humanitarian needs have been skyrocketing even more. MSF teams have witnessed some people dismantling humanitarian facilities and taking with them anything that could potentially be of use: chairs, metal sheeting, tarpaulins, ropes and so on. &nbsp;</p><p>Humanitarian organizations must be guaranteed access to all places of return, and returnees must be able to access essential health services, including support for survivors of sexual violence. Failure to provide these services risks exacerbating people’s health needs.&nbsp;</p></div>
</div>
      </div>
      </div>
  </div>
  </div>
</div>
  </div>
			</div>
</div>
              <div class="field__item">  <div class="paragraph paragraph--type--full-screen-width-image paragraph--view-mode--default">
          
                
        
  
<div class="content__wrapper full-screen__content large-image-wrapper boxed-width-container">

  <figure class="image">
        
                  <source height="893" media="all and (min-width: 1600px)" type="image/jpeg" width="1340" />
              <source height="893" media="all and (min-width: 1170px) and (max-width: 1599px)" type="image/jpeg" width="1340" />
              <source height="512" media="all and (min-width: 768px) and (max-width: 1169px)" type="image/jpeg" width="768" />
              <source height="520" media="all and (min-width: 480px) and (max-width: 767px)" type="image/jpeg" width="780" />
              <source height="410" media="all and (min-width: 320px) and (max-width: 479px)" type="image/jpeg" width="550" />
                  <img alt="People fleeing the conflict in North and South Kivu" height="893" src="https://www.doctorswithoutborders.org/sites/default/files/styles/large_image_1340_893/public/image_base_media/2025/01/MSB220302.jpg?itok=9kgkjPxb" width="1340" />

  


      <div class="image__text full-screen__text">
        <span class="image__meta">
          <figcaption class="figcaption__full-width">
            Displaced people flee to Goma as fighting takes place nearby. <span class="caption-separator"> | </span> DR Congo 2025 © Moses Sawasawa
          </figcaption>
        </span>
      </div>

  </figure>
  </div>
  </div>
</div>
              <div class="field__item">            <div class="paragraph__wysiwyg-text">
        <div class="content__wrapper">
    <div class="body-text  "><h2>Health risks facing Congolese people</h2><div class="text--with-red-top-divider">&nbsp;</div><p>People in DRC have faced acute health needs for years, such as <a href="https://www.doctorswithoutborders.org/what-we-do/medical-issues/ebola" title="Ebola">Ebola</a>, <a href="https://www.doctorswithoutborders.org/what-we-do/medical-issues/hivaids" title="HIV/AIDS">HIV</a>, and recurrent <a href="https://www.doctorswithoutborders.org/what-we-do/medical-issues/cholera" title="Cholera">cholera</a> outbreaks. The conflict has exacerbated the health threats people face in the east, including by causing direct harm to civilians through war-related injuries, increasing the risk of disease outbreaks, and making health care more difficult to access.</p><p>MSF has worked in DRC for 40 years, providing medical and <a href="https://www.doctorswithoutborders.org/what-we-do/medical-issues/mental-health" title="Mental health">mental health</a> care, water and sanitation support, humanitarian relief, and training and other capacity-building activities to strengthen local health response. We respond to disease outbreaks including <a href="https://www.doctorswithoutborders.org/what-we-do/medical-issues/measles" title="Measles">measles</a>, cholera, and <a href="https://www.doctorswithoutborders.org/what-we-do/medical-issues/mpox" title="Mpox">mpox</a>, treat children with <a href="https://www.doctorswithoutborders.org/what-we-do/medical-issues/malnutrition" title="Malnutrition">malnutrition</a> at our inpatient and outpatient therapeutic feeding centers, and have emergency teams on standby throughout DRC, ready to respond to unanticipated disasters.&nbsp;</p></div>
</div>
      </div>
      </div>
              <div class="field__item">
	
		
		
		
		
		
	
	<div class="paragraph paragraph--type--accordion paragraph--view-mode--default">
					
<div class="msf-accordion accordion-container content__wrapper">
      <h2 class="msf-accordion__heading">Medical needs in DR Congo</h2>
  
      <div class="ac ">
  <h3 class="ac-header">
    <button class="ac-trigger"><p>Cholera</p></button>
          <p class="ac-preview-content"> Cholera is endemic to eastern DRC, with recurrent outbreaks across all three provinces.  </p>
      </h3>
  <div class="ac-panel">
    
    
  <div class="field field--name-field-accordion-content-block field--type-entity-reference-revisions field--label-hidden field__items">
        <div class="field__item">            <div class="paragraph__wysiwyg-text">
        <div class="content__wrapper">
    <div class="body-text  "><p>Cholera is endemic to eastern DRC, with recurrent outbreaks across all three provinces. The risk is especially high in camps where displaced people live without access to drinking water and nonfunctional or nonexistent latrines, and following floods. MSF has responded to several cholera outbreaks in the region, including in Minova, <a href="https://www.doctorswithoutborders.org/latest/dr-congo-msf-treats-over-1500-people-cholera-rutshuru" title="DR Congo: MSF treats over 1,500 people for cholera in Rutshuru">Rutshuru</a> territory, and in and around Goma, by setting up cholera treatment centers, oral rehydration points, and isolation units, and distributing clean drinking water.</p></div>
</div>
      </div>
      </div>
  </div>
  </div>
</div>
      <div class="ac ">
  <h3 class="ac-header">
    <button class="ac-trigger"><p>Food insecurity &amp; malnutrition</p></button>
          <p class="ac-preview-content"> Despite being rich with fertile agricultural land, DRC is one of the most food-insecure countries in the world, with more than 23 million people experiencing food insecurity across the country. </p>
      </h3>
  <div class="ac-panel">
    
    
  <div class="field field--name-field-accordion-content-block field--type-entity-reference-revisions field--label-hidden field__items">
        <div class="field__item">            <div class="paragraph__wysiwyg-text">
        <div class="content__wrapper">
    <div class="body-text  "><p>Despite being rich with fertile agricultural land, DRC is one of the most <a href="https://www.doctorswithoutborders.org/latest/when-does-hunger-become-famine" title="When does hunger become famine?">food-insecure</a> countries in the world, with more than <a href="https://www.wfp.org/countries/democratic-republic-congo">23 million</a> people experiencing food insecurity across the country, including an estimated 2.7 million in the eastern provinces of Ituri, North Kivu, and South Kivu alone. Food shortages have led to a significant increase in prices, while checkpoints on roads impede access to farmland, leaving crops abandoned. These factors contribute to <a href="https://www.doctorswithoutborders.org/latest/dr-congo-violence-masisi-territory-causes-severe-malnutrition" title="DR Congo: Violence in Masisi territory causes severe malnutrition ">rising</a> malnutrition rates in DRC.</p><p>MSF teams have seen worrying levels of malnutrition among children in many of our projects in eastern DRC. In 2023, monthly admissions of children for malnutrition doubled, with an average of 800 per month.&nbsp;</p></div>
</div>
      </div>
      </div>
  </div>
  </div>
</div>
      <div class="ac ">
  <h3 class="ac-header">
    <button class="ac-trigger"><p>Measles</p></button>
          <p class="ac-preview-content"> DRC has faced persistent epidemics for years and high fatality rates due to inadequate routine vaccinations and supplementary immunization. </p>
      </h3>
  <div class="ac-panel">
    
    
  <div class="field field--name-field-accordion-content-block field--type-entity-reference-revisions field--label-hidden field__items">
        <div class="field__item">            <div class="paragraph__wysiwyg-text">
        <div class="content__wrapper">
    <div class="body-text  "><p>Measles cases <a href="https://www.doctorswithoutborders.org/latest/why-measles-remains-mass-killer-dr-congo" title="Why measles remains a mass killer in DR Congo">surged</a> in DRC in 2024. DRC has faced <a href="https://www.doctorswithoutborders.org/latest/fighting-one-worlds-most-contagious-diseases-dr-congo" title="Fighting one of the world's most contagious diseases in DR Congo">persistent</a> epidemics for years and high fatality rates due to inadequate routine vaccinations and supplementary immunization. In 2023, over 300,000 measles cases were recorded, resulting in nearly 6,000 deaths. Children are particularly vulnerable; from 2018 to 2020, 8,000 children died from measles during the largest outbreak ever documented in DRC. Despite the persistent threat of measles, vaccine coverage remains insufficient in the country.</p></div>
</div>
      </div>
      </div>
  </div>
  </div>
</div>
      <div class="ac ">
  <h3 class="ac-header">
    <button class="ac-trigger"><p>Mpox</p></button>
          <p class="ac-preview-content"> DRC experienced an mpox outbreak in 2024 affecting all provinces in the country, with a genetic mutation first identified in South Kivu causing uninterrupted human-to-human transmission of the virus. </p>
      </h3>
  <div class="ac-panel">
    
    
  <div class="field field--name-field-accordion-content-block field--type-entity-reference-revisions field--label-hidden field__items">
        <div class="field__item">            <div class="paragraph__wysiwyg-text">
        <div class="content__wrapper">
    <div class="body-text  "><p>The first case of mpox, formerly known as monkeypox, in a human was identified in DRC in 1970, and the disease continues to affect communities there. The risk is particularly high in areas where the natural environment is conducive to its spread, such as dense woodlands where people rely on hunting and fishing for food. &nbsp;</p><p>DRC experienced an mpox outbreak in 2024 affecting all provinces in the country, with a genetic mutation first identified in South Kivu causing uninterrupted human-to-human transmission of the virus. On August 14, the World Health Organization (WHO) director-general <a href="https://www.who.int/news/item/14-08-2024-who-director-general-declares-mpox-outbreak-a-public-health-emergency-of-international-concern">declared</a> that the surge of mpox cases in DRC and a growing number of countries in Africa constitutes a public health emergency of international concern. On September 13, WHO announced that the <a href="https://www.who.int/news/item/13-09-2024-who-prequalifies-the-first-vaccine-against-mpox">MVA-BN vaccine</a> is the first vaccine against mpox to be added to its prequalification list. The MVA-BN vaccine can be administered to people over 18 years old as a two-dose injection given 4 weeks apart.</p><p>In response to the 2024 mpox outbreak, MSF mobilized emergency teams across the country to support local health authorities.</p></div>
</div>
      </div>
      </div>
  </div>
  </div>
</div>
      <div class="ac ">
  <h3 class="ac-header">
    <button class="ac-trigger"><p>Sexual &amp; gender-based violence</p></button>
          <p class="ac-preview-content"> MSF teams in DRC have seen alarming rates of sexual violence as reported by our patients, especially in camps around Goma.  </p>
      </h3>
  <div class="ac-panel">
    
    
  <div class="field field--name-field-accordion-content-block field--type-entity-reference-revisions field--label-hidden field__items">
        <div class="field__item">            <div class="paragraph__wysiwyg-text">
        <div class="content__wrapper">
    <div class="body-text  "><p>MSF teams in DRC have seen <a href="https://www.doctorswithoutborders.org/latest/why-sexual-violence-rise-gomas-displacement-camps" title="Why sexual violence is on the rise in Goma’s displacement camps">alarming</a> rates of <a href="https://www.doctorswithoutborders.org/what-we-do/medical-issues/sexual-and-gender-based-violence" title="Sexual and gender-based violence">sexual violence</a> as reported by our patients, especially in camps around Goma. Most assaults are perpetrated against women searching for food or wood outside the camps, driven to venture out due to lack of access to basic supplies. Our teams treated more than 22,000 survivors of sexual violence in North and South Kivu’s Minova health zonein 2023, and continue to see high numbers of cases at the facilities where we work throughout the region. This represents only the survivors who sought care from MSF; the true number of survivors is likely far higher due to stigma and barriers to accessing care. &nbsp;</p></div>
</div>
      </div>
      </div>
  </div>
  </div>
</div>
      <div class="ac ">
  <h3 class="ac-header">
    <button class="ac-trigger"><p>War wounds &amp; trauma</p></button>
          <p class="ac-preview-content"> As the fighting intensifies near cities, civilians are in increasing jeopardy.  </p>
      </h3>
  <div class="ac-panel">
    
    
  <div class="field field--name-field-accordion-content-block field--type-entity-reference-revisions field--label-hidden field__items">
        <div class="field__item">            <div class="paragraph__wysiwyg-text">
        <div class="content__wrapper">
    <div class="body-text  "><p>As the fighting intensifies near cities, civilians are in increasing jeopardy. MSF teams are treating patients with gunshot wounds and injuries from explosions, including <a href="https://www.doctorswithoutborders.org/latest/small-voices-youngest-victims-conflict-ituri-dr-congo" title="Small voices: The youngest victims of conflict in Ituri, DR Congo">children</a>. At MSF's center specializing in trauma surgery and post-surgical care at Salama Hospital in Bunia, one-third of the 863 patients treated by the end of 2023 were direct victims of the violence.&nbsp;</p></div>
</div>
      </div>
      </div>
  </div>
  </div>
</div>
  </div>
			</div>
</div>

              <div class="field__item">
	
		
		
		
	
	<div class="paragraph paragraph--type--accordion paragraph--view-mode--default">
					
<div class="msf-accordion accordion-container content__wrapper">
      <h2 class="msf-accordion__heading">Challenges impacting people's health</h2>
  
      <div class="ac ">
  <h3 class="ac-header">
    <button class="ac-trigger"><p>Low vaccination coverage</p></button>
          <p class="ac-preview-content"> Vaccination coverage among children under 5 years old in DRC is currently the lowest in about 30 years. </p>
      </h3>
  <div class="ac-panel">
    
    
  <div class="field field--name-field-accordion-content-block field--type-entity-reference-revisions field--label-hidden field__items">
        <div class="field__item">            <div class="paragraph__wysiwyg-text">
        <div class="content__wrapper">
    <div class="body-text  "><p><a href="https://www.doctorswithoutborders.org/what-we-do/medical-issues/vaccination" title="Vaccination">Vaccination</a> coverage among children under 5 years old in DRC is currently the lowest in about 30 years, according to the World Health Organization (WHO). Low coverage, along with a shortage of medicines and medical supplies and poorly functioning health structures, has increased the risk of disease outbreaks in DRC for years, but the current escalation has worsened the threat by forcing more people into crowded, unsanitary camps as they flee the violence. &nbsp;</p></div>
</div>
      </div>
      </div>
  </div>
  </div>
</div>
      <div class="ac ">
  <h3 class="ac-header">
    <button class="ac-trigger"><p>Lack of access to health care</p></button>
          <p class="ac-preview-content"> Even before the recent escalation of violence, DRC’s health care infrastructure was fragile with insufficient funding and a lack of resources. </p>
      </h3>
  <div class="ac-panel">
    
    
  <div class="field field--name-field-accordion-content-block field--type-entity-reference-revisions field--label-hidden field__items">
        <div class="field__item">            <div class="paragraph__wysiwyg-text">
        <div class="content__wrapper">
    <div class="body-text  "><p>Even before the recent escalation of violence, DRC’s health care infrastructure was fragile with insufficient funding and a lack of resources. The conflict has made health care even more difficult to access, forcing staff and patients to abandon facilities near the fighting and restricting people’s ability to reach care through checkpoints and impassable roads. The facilities that remain functional are overwhelmed and undersupplied, with several patients sharing beds. Some have been <a href="https://www.doctorswithoutborders.org/latest/dr-congo-patient-killed-drodro-hospital-attack" title="DR Congo: Patient killed in Drodro hospital attack">attacked</a>.</p><p><a href="https://www.doctorswithoutborders.org/latest/village-protecting-mothers-and-babies-dr-congo" title="The village protecting mothers and babies in DR Congo">Pregnant women</a>, particularly those with high-risk pregnancies or complications, are at particular risk, often delaying or foregoing seeking care due to difficulty getting to health facilities. DRC has some of the highest rates of maternal and neonatal deaths in the world.</p><p>To strengthen local health care infrastructure and improve the quality of medical care throughout DRC, MSF teams are training local medical staff, improving the quality of biomedical equipment, supporting the referral system, donating medical equipment, and constructing health infrastructure.</p></div>
</div>
      </div>
      </div>
  </div>
  </div>
</div>
      <div class="ac ">
  <h3 class="ac-header">
    <button class="ac-trigger"><p>Logistical &amp; geographic obstacles</p></button>
          <p class="ac-preview-content"> People living in remote areas of DRC often have to travel dozens of miles through the bush to reach health facilities, delaying care. </p>
      </h3>
  <div class="ac-panel">
    
    
  <div class="field field--name-field-accordion-content-block field--type-entity-reference-revisions field--label-hidden field__items">
        <div class="field__item">            <div class="paragraph__wysiwyg-text">
        <div class="content__wrapper">
    <div class="body-text  "><p>People living in remote areas of DRC often have to travel dozens of miles through the bush to reach health facilities, delaying care. These remote areas are also difficult for health workers to access during vaccination campaigns. Further, it’s sometimes not possible to transport medical supplies like vaccines by foot, because they require refrigeration.&nbsp;</p><p>MSF teams use motorcycles and canoes to reach remote communities, but the gaps in care remain.</p></div>
</div>
      </div>
      </div>
  </div>
  </div>
</div>
      <div class="ac ">
  <h3 class="ac-header">
    <button class="ac-trigger"><p>Water &amp; sanitation needs</p></button>
          <p class="ac-preview-content"> Extreme weather events linked with climate change and longer rainy seasons increase the risk of diseases in DRC by causing floods and damaging water infrastructure. </p>
      </h3>
  <div class="ac-panel">
    
    
  <div class="field field--name-field-accordion-content-block field--type-entity-reference-revisions field--label-hidden field__items">
        <div class="field__item">            <div class="paragraph__wysiwyg-text">
        <div class="content__wrapper">
    <div class="body-text  "><p>Extreme weather events linked with <a href="https://www.doctorswithoutborders.org/what-we-do/focus/climate-change-emergency" title="Climate emergency">climate change</a> and longer rainy seasons increase the risk of diseases in DRC by causing floods and damaging water infrastructure. Cholera and skin infections thrive in settings with a contaminated water supply, while mosquitoes that spread diseases like malaria and dengue, which breed in standing water, proliferate.</p><p>To curb the spread of disease in camps, MSF provides clean drinking water and constructs and improves water and sanitation infrastructure, including latrines and showers. MSF built a <a href="https://www.doctorswithoutborders.org/latest/turning-taps-gomas-makeshift-camps" title="Turning on the taps in Goma’s makeshift camps ">water pumping and chlorination station</a> on the shores of Lake Kivu that processes up to 2 million liters (more than 500,000 gallons) of water each day and distributed hundreds of thousands of gallons of potable water each day to camps around Goma in 2023. We also built a 2-mile pipeline to connect Lushagala camp to a water treatment plant in Bulengo, and installed a platform to distribute up to 200,000 liters (more than 50,000 gallons) of water per day in Rusayo. In response to the <a href="https://www.doctorswithoutborders.org/latest/congo-river-floods-leave-families-no-means-support" title="Congo River floods leave families with no means of support">Congo River floods</a> in early 2024, MSF teams installed latrines, showers, and lighting; and distributed tents and drinking water to people affected.&nbsp;</p></div>
</div>
      </div>
      </div>
  </div>
  </div>
</div>
  </div>
			</div>
</div>
              <div class="field__item">  <div class="paragraph paragraph--type--full-screen-width-image paragraph--view-mode--default">
          
                
        
  
<div class="content__wrapper full-screen__content large-image-wrapper boxed-width-container">

  <figure class="image">
        
                  <source height="893" media="all and (min-width: 1600px)" type="image/jpeg" width="1340" />
              <source height="893" media="all and (min-width: 1170px) and (max-width: 1599px)" type="image/jpeg" width="1340" />
              <source height="512" media="all and (min-width: 768px) and (max-width: 1169px)" type="image/jpeg" width="768" />
              <source height="520" media="all and (min-width: 480px) and (max-width: 767px)" type="image/jpeg" width="780" />
              <source height="410" media="all and (min-width: 320px) and (max-width: 479px)" type="image/jpeg" width="550" />
                  <img alt="An MSF health promotion team holds an awareness-raising session on good hygiene practices to reduce the risk of contracting cholera for residents of Kashaka camp, DR Congo." height="893" src="https://www.doctorswithoutborders.org/sites/default/files/styles/large_image_1340_893/public/image_base_media/2025/02/MSB221460.jpg?itok=RUDz64cn" width="1340" />

  


      <div class="image__text full-screen__text">
        <span class="image__meta">
          <figcaption class="figcaption__full-width">
            An MSF health promotion team holds an awareness-raising session on good hygiene practices to reduce the risk of contracting cholera for residents of Kashaka camp near Goma. <span class="caption-separator"> | </span> DR Congo 2025 ©&nbsp;Daniel Buuma
          </figcaption>
        </span>
      </div>

  </figure>
  </div>
  </div>
</div>
              <div class="field__item">            <div class="paragraph__wysiwyg-text">
        <div class="content__wrapper">
    <div class="body-text  "><h2>Where we provide aid in eastern DR Congo</h2><div class="text--with-red-top-divider">&nbsp;</div><p>Even as the situation in and around Goma evolves rapidly, MSF teams continue to provide vital assistance to people still living in camps. This includes providing medical care, malnutrition treatment, cholera treatment, and care for survivors of sexual violence. MSF is also distributing clean water and food and reinforcing sanitation in the camps. &nbsp;</p><p>Our teams also operate in cities and communities throughout DRC where people are settled, including in the eastern provinces affected by the conflict.</p></div>
</div>
      </div>
      </div>
              <div class="field__item">
	
		
		
	
	<div class="paragraph paragraph--type--accordion paragraph--view-mode--default">
					
<div class="msf-accordion accordion-container content__wrapper">
  
      <div class="ac ">
  <h3 class="ac-header">
    <button class="ac-trigger"><p>North Kivu</p></button>
      </h3>
  <div class="ac-panel">
    
    
  <div class="field field--name-field-accordion-content-block field--type-entity-reference-revisions field--label-hidden field__items">
        <div class="field__item">            <div class="paragraph__wysiwyg-text">
        <div class="content__wrapper">
    <div class="body-text  "><ul><li>In the city of Goma, we support two health facilities providing medical care and psychosocial support for children in street situations, and sex workers. &nbsp;</li><li>In Walikale territory, MSF supports pediatrics and maternal care at the general referral hospital, provides partial support for seven health centers, and offers care for survivors of sexual violence at a dedicated clinic.</li><li>In Rutshuru territory, MSF supports the general referral hospital and six health centers providing pediatric care, family planning, and treatment for malnutrition and victims of sexual violence.</li><li>In the Sake area, MSF provides vaccinations, cholera response, and constructs latrines in camps.</li><li>In Kibirizi, Binza, Masisi, and Mweso health zones, we support hospitals and health centers in emergency room care, pediatrics, family planning, nutrition, and care for victims of sexual violence. We provide malnutrition care at therapeutic feeding centers in Masisi and Mweso.</li></ul></div>
</div>
      </div>
      </div>
  </div>
  </div>
</div>
      <div class="ac ">
  <h3 class="ac-header">
    <button class="ac-trigger"><p>Ituri</p></button>
      </h3>
  <div class="ac-panel">
    
    
  <div class="field field--name-field-accordion-content-block field--type-entity-reference-revisions field--label-hidden field__items">
        <div class="field__item">            <div class="paragraph__wysiwyg-text">
        <div class="content__wrapper">
    <div class="body-text  "><ul><li>In Bunia, MSF set up a center specializing in trauma surgery and post-surgical care at Salama Hospital and supports Kishinji Health Center, which provides care for both local and displaced people and referrals of severe cases to Minova General Referral Hospital.</li><li>In Drodro and Angumu, Ituri province, MSF supports two Ministry of Health hospitals, 12 health centers, three advanced health posts, and 20 community care sites.</li><li>MSF teams are rehabilitating the health center at Blukwa'Mbi to transform it into a referral center that can provide specialist medical care. It includes a solar-powered operatic theater.</li><li>In Bambo health zone, MSF supports the emergency room, pediatrics, intensive therapeutic nutritional unit, and treatment for victims of sexual violence at the general referral hospital. &nbsp;</li></ul></div>
</div>
      </div>
      </div>
  </div>
  </div>
</div>
      <div class="ac ">
  <h3 class="ac-header">
    <button class="ac-trigger"><p>South Kivu</p></button>
      </h3>
  <div class="ac-panel">
    
    
  <div class="field field--name-field-accordion-content-block field--type-entity-reference-revisions field--label-hidden field__items">
        <div class="field__item">            <div class="paragraph__wysiwyg-text">
        <div class="content__wrapper">
    <div class="body-text  "><p>In Minova health zone, MSF supports Kishinji Health Center, which provides care for both local and displaced people and referrals of severe cases to Minova General Referral Hospital. We also support three health centers where we treat children for malnutrition and survivors of sexual violence.&nbsp;</p></div>
</div>
      </div>
      </div>
  </div>
  </div>
</div>
  </div>

                <div class="class">
          <p class="caption  caption-large mbt__text-content__desc">MSF is adapting its emergency response as the situation evolves in and around Goma, with displaced people fleeing once again.</p>
        </div>
                  
<a class="link-item link-bold mbt__text-content__link link-icon--right-arrow" href="https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=LQ2yDdVFg-Y">Watch on YouTube</a>

              <div class="field__item">  <div class="bullet-box">
  <div class="bullet-box__header">
    <h2 class="heading-2 bullet-box__heading">Timeline: 2025 escalation</h2>
  </div>
  <div class="bullet-box__description">
    <p>The conflict between M23/AFC, the Congolese armed forces, and their respective allies has changed rapidly this year. Here are some key moments.</p>
  </div>

  <div class="bullet-box__bullets">
    
  <div class="field field--name-field-list-items field--type-entity-reference-revisions field--label-hidden field__items">
        <div class="field__item">        
            
  <div class="bullet-card">
  <div class="bullet-card__body">
    <div class="bullet-card__description">
              <h3 class="heading-3 bullet-card__heading">MSF treats casualties amid major clashes in Masisi territory</h3>
      
              <time class="bullet-card__time" datetime="January 3-6">January 3-6</time>
      
      <p>Fighting between M23/AFC and the Congolese army, backed by its allies, takes place in Masisi territory, North Kivu province, sending mass casualties to health facilities where MSF teams treat the wounded, including Masisi General Reference Hospital and Nyabiondo Reference Health Center. According to OCHA, more than 100,000 are displaced in less than a week in Masisi territory.</p>

      
              <div class="bullet-card__read-more">
          
<a class="link-item link-bold link-icon--right-arrow bullet-card__read-more-link" href="https://www.doctorswithoutborders.org/latest/dr-congo-msf-responds-after-new-m23-clashes">Read more</a>
        </div>
          </div>

      </div>
</div>
</div>
        <div class="field__item">        
            
  <div class="bullet-card">
  <div class="bullet-card__body">
    <div class="bullet-card__description">
              <h3 class="heading-3 bullet-card__heading">Civilians hit in fighting near Masisi General Referral Hospital</h3>
      
              <time class="bullet-card__time" datetime="January 16">January 16</time>
      
      <p>Intense gunfire breaks out in the immediate vicinity of Masisi General Referral Hospital in North Kivu. Two civilians are hit, with one dying and the other receiving treatment from Ministry of Health and MSF doctors.&nbsp;</p>

      
              <div class="bullet-card__read-more">
          
<a class="link-item link-bold link-icon--right-arrow bullet-card__read-more-link" href="https://www.doctorswithoutborders.org/latest/dr-congo-msf-responds-after-new-m23-clashes">Read more</a>
        </div>
          </div>

      </div>
</div>
</div>
        <div class="field__item">        
            
  <div class="bullet-card">
  <div class="bullet-card__body">
    <div class="bullet-card__description">
              <h3 class="heading-3 bullet-card__heading">Reports of shelling, shooting, and looting in Goma</h3>
      
              <time class="bullet-card__time" datetime="January 27">January 27</time>
      
      <p>Violence in Goma causes widespread panic and displacement. MSF teams at Kyeshero Hospital receive injured people referred by the International Committee of the Red Cross (ICRC) from the overcrowded Ndosho Hospital.</p>

      
              <div class="bullet-card__read-more">
          
<a class="link-item link-bold link-icon--right-arrow bullet-card__read-more-link" href="https://www.doctorswithoutborders.org/latest/what-know-about-intensified-conflict-dr-congo">Read more</a>
        </div>
          </div>

      </div>
</div>
</div>
        <div class="field__item">        
            
  <div class="bullet-card">
  <div class="bullet-card__body">
    <div class="bullet-card__description">
              <h3 class="heading-3 bullet-card__heading">MSF appeals for humanitarian access in eastern DRC</h3>
      
              <time class="bullet-card__time" datetime="January 29">January 29</time>
      
      <p>As armed clashes rage in Goma, MSF teams continue to treat the influx of wounded patients at Kyeshero Hospital in the city. Non-essential staff are relocated out of Goma as of Wednesday morning while MSF prepares to send new teams into Goma.</p>

      
              <div class="bullet-card__read-more">
          
<a class="link-item link-bold link-icon--right-arrow bullet-card__read-more-link" href="https://www.doctorswithoutborders.org/latest/msf-appeals-humanitarian-access-eastern-dr-congo">Read more</a>
        </div>
          </div>

      </div>
</div>
</div>
        <div class="field__item">        
            
  <div class="bullet-card">
  <div class="bullet-card__body">
    <div class="bullet-card__description">
              <h3 class="heading-3 bullet-card__heading">Thousands flee to Burundi</h3>
      
              <time class="bullet-card__time" datetime="February 18">February 18</time>
      
      <p>As thousands flee DRC to neighboring Burundi, MSF teams in Citiboke assess needs and provide people with emergency assistance.&nbsp;</p>

      
              <div class="bullet-card__read-more">

  <div class="bullet-card">
  <div class="bullet-card__body">
    <div class="bullet-card__description">
              <h3 class="heading-3 bullet-card__heading">Movements blocked in Uvira as violence spreads in South Kivu</h3>
      
              <time class="bullet-card__time" datetime="February 19">February 19</time>
      
      <p>Armed clashes and looting block all movement, including of ambulances, in Uvira, South Kivu. MSF teams closely assess the situation in the province and explore ways to scale up our emergency response in areas in and around Minova, Bukavu, and Uvira.&nbsp;</p>

      
              <div class="bullet-card__read-more">

    <div class="bullet-card__description">
              <h3 class="heading-3 bullet-card__heading">Gunshots hit MSF base in Masisi, wounding two</h3>
      
              <time class="bullet-card__time" datetime="February 20">February 20</time>
      
      <p>The gunfire wounds an MSF staff member, Jerry Muhindo Kavali, and a child sheltering in the compound. MSF strongly condemns the shootings. Tragically, two days later, Jerry dies from his wound.</p>

      
              <div class="bullet-card__read-more">

Title    : How we're responding to the war in Gaza
Published: Sat, 14 Oct 2023 23:50:39 +0000
Summary  :
<span>How we're responding to the war in Gaza</span>

  <div class="field field--name-field-subtitle field--type-string field--label-hidden field__items">
        <div class="field__item">What to know about the humanitarian catastrophe in Gaza and MSF’s medical and humanitarian response.</div>
  </div>
<span><span>Taylor Darnall</span></span>

<span><time datetime="2023-10-14T19:50:39-04:00" title="Saturday, October 14, 2023 - 7:50pm">October 14 2023, 7:50pm</time>
</span>

  <div class="field field--name-field-hero-image field--type-entity-reference field--label-hidden field__items">
        <div class="field__item">  <img alt="alt" height="1080" src="https://www.doctorswithoutborders.org/sites/default/files/MSB219806%28High%29%20%282%29.png" width="1920" />

</div>
  </div>
      <div class="field field--content-blocks field--label-hidden field__items">
              <div class="field__item">            <div class="paragraph__wysiwyg-text">
        <div class="content__wrapper">
    <div class="body-text  "><p>Since the start of the war in October 2023, more than 48,000 <a href="https://www.doctorswithoutborders.org/what-we-do/where-we-work/palestine" title="Palestine">Palestinians</a> have been killed in Gaza, more than 112,000 wounded, and thousands are estimated to be buried under the wreckage. Over 1.9 million people—90 percent of the entire population—have been forcibly displaced, often many times. Water and food are still severely limited, essential supplies like fuel and electricity are scant, and as the threat of disease and starvation continues, lifesaving health care remains inaccessible.&nbsp;</p><p>Doctors Without Borders/Médecins Sans Frontières (MSF) teams are witnessing firsthand how this war has turned Gaza's chronic humanitarian crisis into a catastrophe.</p></div>
</div>
      </div>
      </div>
              <div class="field__item">


  <div class="card-carousel">
  <header class="card-carousel__header">
    <h2> Gaza at a glance </h2>
    <div class="card-carousel__nav">
      <button class="card-carousel__prev">
        <svg fill="none" height="10" viewBox="0 0 18 10" width="18" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg">
          <path d="M1.44351 0.778176L9.22168 8.55635L16.9999 0.778176" stroke="white" stroke-width="2">
        </svg>
      </button>
      <button class="card-carousel__next">
        <svg fill="none" height="10" viewBox="0 0 18 10" width="18" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg">
          <path d="M1.44351 0.778176L9.22168 8.55635L16.9999 0.778176" stroke="white" stroke-width="2">
        </svg>
      </button>
    </div>
  </header>
  <div class="card-carousel__wrapper">
          <div class="card-carousel__item">
          <div class="paragraph paragraph--type--numbered-list-card paragraph--view-mode--default">

  
  
  <article class="carousel-card carousel-card--numberd">
  <header class="carousel-card__header">
    <h3 class="carousel-card__title">The war's impact</h3>
  </header>
  <div class="carousel-card__body">
    <div class="carousel-card__text">
              <div class="carousel-card__bullet-box"> <span class="carousel-card__bullet"> 1 </span> <p>92% of all housing units and 70% of all structures in Gaza have been damaged or destroyed </p> </div>
              <div class="carousel-card__bullet-box"> <span class="carousel-card__bullet"> 2 </span> <p>1.2 million people face emergency or catastrophic levels of food insecurity (IPC Phase 4 and 5) </p> </div>
              <div class="carousel-card__bullet-box"> <span class="carousel-card__bullet"> 3 </span> <p>Over 1,000 health workers have been killed  </p> </div>
              <div class="carousel-card__bullet-box"> <span class="carousel-card__bullet"> 4 </span> <p>1.9 million people—half the population—has been displaced </p> </div>
          </div>
  </div>
</article>


  </div>

      </div>
          <div class="card-carousel__item">
          <div class="paragraph paragraph--type--image-card paragraph--view-mode--default">
                                  
      <article class="carousel-card carousel-card--image">
  <div class="carousel-card__body">
    <figure class="image">

              <source height="440" media="all and (min-width: 1170px) and (max-width: 1599px)" type="image/jpeg" width="586" />
              <source height="440" media="all and (min-width: 768px) and (max-width: 1169px)" type="image/jpeg" width="586" />

  <div class="carousel-card__body">
    <figure class="image">
          
                  <source height="440" media="all and (min-width: 1600px)" type="image/jpeg" width="586" />
              <source height="440" media="all and (min-width: 1170px) and (max-width: 1599px)" type="image/jpeg" width="586" />

	<div class="paragraph paragraph--type--accordion paragraph--view-mode--default">
					
<div class="msf-accordion accordion-container content__wrapper">
      <h2 class="msf-accordion__heading">How we're responding in Gaza</h2>
  
      <div class="ac ">
  <h3 class="ac-header">
    <button class="ac-trigger"><p>How is MSF helping in Gaza right now?</p></button>
      </h3>
  <div class="ac-panel">
    
    
  <div class="field field--name-field-accordion-content-block field--type-entity-reference-revisions field--label-hidden field__items">
        <div class="field__item">            <div class="paragraph__wysiwyg-text">
        <div class="content__wrapper">
    <div class="body-text  "><p>With over 1,000 staff on the ground, our teams in Gaza provide surgical support, wound care, physiotherapy, maternity and pediatric care, primary health care, vaccination, and mental health services, as well as water distribution. However massive challenges and constraints related to supplies, displacement, and destruction of infrastructure are limiting our activities.</p><p>While Israeli authorities continued to impose obstacles and blockages for medical evacuations from Gaza, our teams have managed to successfully evacuate 13 <a href="https://www.doctorswithoutborders.org/latest/long-road-recovery-gazas-war-wounded-children" title="The long road to recovery for Gaza’s war-wounded children">child patients</a> and 11 caretakers to our reconstructive surgery hospital in Amman, <a href="https://www.doctorswithoutborders.org/what-we-do/where-we-work/jordan" title="Jordan">Jordan</a>, where they receive comprehensive rehabilitative care for wounds sustained in Israeli airstrikes.&nbsp;</p><h4>Medical services</h4><p>MSF staff have been working in Gaza’s hospitals and clinics throughout the war. Our teams provide a range of essential medical services including: &nbsp;</p><ul><li>Surgical care &nbsp;</li><li>Wound and burn care &nbsp;</li><li>Postpartum care &nbsp;</li><li>Physiotherapy &nbsp; &nbsp;</li><li>Maternal and pediatric care</li><li>Vaccination &nbsp; &nbsp;</li><li>Mental health support&nbsp;</li></ul><p>In over 15 months of war, our teams have continually adapted to extremely volatile conditions on the ground, including Israeli forces’ recurrent <a href="https://www.doctorswithoutborders.org/latest/new-evacuation-orders-threaten-exacerbate-humanitarian-catastrophe-gaza" title="New evacuation orders worsen the humanitarian catastrophe in Gaza">evacuation orders</a> and <a href="https://www.doctorswithoutborders.org/latest/how-israeli-army-besieged-nasser-hospital" title="How the Israeli army besieged Nasser Hospital">sieges</a> of various hospitals in the Strip.&nbsp;</p></div>
</div>
      </div>
      </div>
        <div class="field__item">

      
      

                         


 
<div class="content__wrapper layout-flexible-block">
  <div class="layout-content-block">
    <div class="layout--two-column">
            <div class="layout-content__col-1">
                <div class="layout-content__image-content">
              
                  <source height="392" media="all and (min-width: 1600px)" type="image/jpeg" width="525" />
              <source height="392" media="all and (min-width: 1170px) and (max-width: 1599px)" type="image/jpeg" width="525" />
              <source height="392" media="all and (min-width: 768px) and (max-width: 1169px)" type="image/jpeg" width="525" />
              <source height="358" media="all and (min-width: 480px) and (max-width: 767px)" type="image/jpeg" width="480" />
              <source height="250" media="all and (min-width: 320px) and (max-width: 479px)" type="image/jpeg" width="335" />
                  <img alt="MSF teams at Al-Aqsa Hospital respond to bombings in Gaza's Middle Area, including Nuseirat camp, on June 8." height="392" src="https://www.doctorswithoutborders.org/sites/default/files/styles/layout_flexible_image_525_392/public/image_base_media/2024/06/MSB198975.jpg?itok=mJcUq5ox" width="525" />

  

        </div>
               </div>
             <div class="layout-content__col-2">
                <div class="layout-content__image-content">
              
                  <source height="392" media="all and (min-width: 1600px)" type="image/jpeg" width="525" />
              <source height="392" media="all and (min-width: 1170px) and (max-width: 1599px)" type="image/jpeg" width="525" />
              <source height="392" media="all and (min-width: 768px) and (max-width: 1169px)" type="image/jpeg" width="525" />
              <source height="358" media="all and (min-width: 480px) and (max-width: 767px)" type="image/jpeg" width="480" />
              <source height="250" media="all and (min-width: 320px) and (max-width: 479px)" type="image/jpeg" width="335" />
                  <img alt="A mother and newborn recover in Al Nasser Hospital in Gaza. " height="392" src="https://www.doctorswithoutborders.org/sites/default/files/styles/layout_flexible_image_525_392/public/image_base_media/2024/07/MSB201461.jpg?itok=vufrVmpb" width="525" />

  

        </div>
               </div>
           </div>
     <p class="caption caption-small  layout-content__centered-caption">From left: MSF teams respond to mass casualties at Al-Aqsa Hospital on June 8, Palestine 2024 © Karin Huster/MSF; a patient who gave birth at Nasser Hospital, Palestine 2024 ©&nbsp;Mariam Abu Dagga/MSF</p>
   </div>
</div>
</div>
        <div class="field__item">            <div class="paragraph__wysiwyg-text">
        <div class="content__wrapper">
    <div class="body-text  "><h4>Hospitals and clinics we have supported</h4><ul><li>Nasser Hospital, European Gaza Hospital, and Martyrs, Beni Suhaila, Khan Younis, and Al Athar clinics in Khan Younis</li><li>Al-Aqsa Hospital in Deir al-Balah &nbsp; &nbsp;</li><li>Al-Awda Hospital in northern Gaza</li><li>Al-Shifa Hospital in Gaza City &nbsp; &nbsp;</li><li>Rafah Indonesian Field Hospital, Emirati Maternity Hospital, Al-Najjar Hospital, and Al-Mawasi Health Post in Rafah&nbsp;</li></ul><h6><a href="https://www.doctorswithoutborders.org/msf-operations-gaza" title="MSF operations in Gaza">Learn more about our medical operations in Gaza &gt;&gt;</a></h6></div>
</div>
      </div>
      </div>
        <div class="field__item">            <div class="paragraph__wysiwyg-text">
        <div class="content__wrapper">
    <div class="body-text  "><h4>Water and sanitation&nbsp;</h4><p>A dire lack of drinkable water, poor sanitation, and the destruction of water infrastructure have had dire consequences for people’s health in Gaza, including the spread of diseases and skin infections. This is why <a href="https://www.doctorswithoutborders.org/latest/water-resource-more-precious-each-day-gaza" title="Water: A resource more precious each day in Gaza">water distribution</a> is an important part of MSF’s response. &nbsp;</p><p>In January 2025, MSF distributed 500,000 liters of desalinated water per day at more than 64 water points across Al-Mawasi, Khan Younis, Rafah, and Deir al-Balah. Since the ceasefire was implemented, our teams have also started water trucking activities in the north to increase access. We are continuously working to increase distribution as drinkable water remains scarce in Gaza. &nbsp;</p><p>In Deir al-Balah and Khan Younis, MSF has been implementing water and sanitation activities in camp shelters through a partnership with the Agriculture Development Association (PARC). This includes building latrines, distributing hygiene kits, and providing water treatment units. We also equipped a camp hosting 400 people with disabilities with <a href="https://www.doctorswithoutborders.org/latest/building-accessible-sanitation-facilities-displaced-people-gaza" title="Building accessible sanitation facilities for displaced people in Gaza">accessible</a> latrines and showers.&nbsp;</p></div>
</div>
      </div>
      </div>
        <div class="field__item">            <div class="paragraph__wysiwyg-text">
        <div class="content__wrapper">
    <div class="body-text  "><h4>Humanitarian aid and medical supplies &nbsp;</h4><p>Since October 2023, MSF has provided 636 tons of logistic and medical equipment from our international supply centers—as much as 30 planes or 130 trucks full. However, some supplies critical to our operations and the security of our staff have been difficult to transport into Gaza, including generators, desalination stations and motor pumps, oxygen concentrators, vehicles, and equipment for communication.</p></div>
</div>
      </div>
      </div>
  </div>
  </div>
</div>
      <div class="ac ">
  <h3 class="ac-header">
    <button class="ac-trigger"><p>What are the medical needs MSF is seeing in Gaza?</p></button>
      </h3>
  <div class="ac-panel">
    
    
  <div class="field field--name-field-accordion-content-block field--type-entity-reference-revisions field--label-hidden field__items">
        <div class="field__item">            <div class="paragraph__wysiwyg-text">
        <div class="content__wrapper">
    <div class="body-text  "><p>The medical needs in Gaza are immense. Many Palestinians require urgent assistance—including people trapped under rubble, pregnant women who are about to deliver, and the elderly—and are not able to access the care they need. The core needs MSF is seeing and seeking to address include: &nbsp; &nbsp;</p><h4>Health care infrastructure</h4><p>The <a href="https://www.doctorswithoutborders.org/latest/gaza-threat-rafah-ground-invasion-looms-silent-killings-continue" title="Gaza: &quot;Silent killings&quot; continue as Rafah invasion looms">collapse</a> of health care infrastructure due to repeated attacks and lack of supplies has made medical care increasingly inaccessible as the overwhelming needs continue to grow. There have been more than 500 attacks on health care since the war started, according to <a href="https://www.ochaopt.org/content/humanitarian-situation-update-221-gaza-strip">OCHA</a>, and out of the 36 main hospitals serving over 2 million people in Gaza, only 17 are functional—and only partially so.&nbsp;</p><h4>War wounds, crush injuries, and burns care</h4><p>War wounds, crush injuries, and burns treatment remain an urgent need as Israeli bombardment and attacks continue. But with very little capacity inside hospitals and a dire lack of medical supplies, people aren’t getting the care they need to heal properly or even survive.</p><h4>Infections</h4><p>Infections resulting from poorly treated wounds are a growing concern, driven by the difficulty wounded people face accessing care and follow-up, shortages of supplies, and lack of access to hygiene.</p><h4>Disease outbreaks</h4><p>Infectious diseases including diarrhea, acute respiratory infections, skin infections, and hepatitis are on the rise due to overcrowding and poor hygienic conditions in camps where displaced people are sheltering, and <a href="https://www.doctorswithoutborders.org/latest/msf-supported-facilities-across-gaza-face-critical-shortages-medical-supplies" title="Gaza: Critical shortages of medical supplies in MSF-supported facilities">shortages</a> of medicines and medical supplies.</p><h4>Starvation</h4><p>Starvation is inevitable under the Israeli government’s policy of deliberate deprivation, and we are already seeing the impacts of food insecurity and hunger. According to the Integrated Food Security Classification (IPC), almost half a million people (22 percent of the population of Gaza) are facing catastrophic levels of acute food insecurity, and the high risk of famine will persist across the whole Strip as long as the war continues and humanitarian access remains restricted. &nbsp;</p><h4>Maternal and child care</h4><p>In addition to the destruction or closures of once-functioning hospitals, the decimation of infrastructure has created severe obstacles for pregnant women trying to reach medical facilities. <a href="https://www.doctorswithoutborders.org/latest/what-its-be-pregnant-gaza" title="What it's like to be pregnant in Gaza right now">Pregnant women</a> are often forced to navigate unsafe routes amid the fighting and without safe transportation—often delaying access to health care and putting them at higher risk of complications.&nbsp;</p></div>
</div>
      </div>
      </div>
  </div>
  </div>
</div>
      <div class="ac ">
  <h3 class="ac-header">
    <button class="ac-trigger"><p>How is MSF responding in the West Bank?&nbsp;</p></button>
      </h3>
  <div class="ac-panel">
    
    
  <div class="field field--name-field-accordion-content-block field--type-entity-reference-revisions field--label-hidden field__items">
        <div class="field__item">            <div class="paragraph__wysiwyg-text">
        <div class="content__wrapper">
    <div class="body-text  "><p>Since the ceasefire in Gaza was implemented in January, MSF teams in the West Bank have observed an <a href="https://www.doctorswithoutborders.org/latest/qa-whats-happening-west-bank-right-now" title="Q&amp;A: What’s happening in the West Bank right now">escalation</a> of extreme violence, particularly in Jenin, Tulkarem, and Tubas. Severe <a href="https://www.doctorswithoutborders.org/latest/palestine-msf-report-finds-escalating-attacks-and-obstruction-health-care-west-bank" title="Palestine: MSF report finds escalating attacks and obstruction of health care in the West Bank">movement restrictions</a> imposed by Israeli forces—including road closures, prolonged delays at checkpoints, and the installation of new gates at village entrances—are impeding people’s access to health care and basic needs. The World Health Organization (WHO) reports that there have been <a href="https://www.unocha.org/publications/report/occupied-palestinian-territory/humanitarian-situation-update-258-west-bank#:~:text=This%20is%20particularly%20true%20during,medical%20facilities%20and%20475%20ambulances.">694 attacks</a> on health care in the West Bank since October 2023, including obstruction of access, use of force, detention, and militarized search.</p><p>MSF teams in the West Bank are expanding efforts to reach communities where people are unable to access care, bolstering local emergency response, and addressing the needs of Gazans who have been stranded in the West Bank after losing their work permits in Israel. Our activities include:</p><ul><li><strong>Supporting five primary health centers and running 15 mobile clinics</strong> in the Hebron area, including the Old City, and remote villages in the southern West Bank such as Masafer Yatta</li><li><strong>Donations to hospitals and first-aid kits for community focal points</strong> in Beit Omar and Al Rshaydeh, and the emergency care center in Um El Khair</li><li><strong>Providing relief items, hygiene kits, and food parcels</strong> to displaced Gazans and West Bank residents affected by violence and displacement</li><li><strong>Increasing capacity at hospitals</strong> including Halhoul, Thabet Thabet, Al-Mohtaseb, Jenin, and Khalil Suleiman</li><li><strong>Training medical staff </strong>at Al-Mohtaseb, Halhoul, Dura, and Yatta hospitals in the Hebron area.&nbsp;</li><li><strong>Providing mental health care&nbsp;</strong></li><li><strong>Expanding health promotion activities</strong></li></ul></div>
</div>
      </div>
      </div>
  </div>
  </div>
</div>
      <div class="ac ">
  <h3 class="ac-header">
    <button class="ac-trigger"><p>Is MSF providing medical care in Israel?</p></button>
      </h3>
  <div class="ac-panel">
    
    
  <div class="field field--name-field-accordion-content-block field--type-entity-reference-revisions field--label-hidden field__items">
        <div class="field__item">            <div class="paragraph__wysiwyg-text">
        <div class="content__wrapper">
    <div class="body-text  "><p>MSF does not currently run medical programs in Israel but offered its support to Israeli hospitals treating large numbers of casualties following the Hamas attacks on October 7. We focus on filling the greatest gaps in health care, and Israel has strong emergency and health systems.&nbsp;</p></div>
</div>
      </div>
      </div>
  </div>
  </div>
</div>
      <div class="ac ">
  <h3 class="ac-header">
    <button class="ac-trigger"><p>What does it mean to be an independent and impartial medical humanitarian organization?</p></button>
      </h3>
  <div class="ac-panel">
    
    
  <div class="field field--name-field-accordion-content-block field--type-entity-reference-revisions field--label-hidden field__items">
        <div class="field__item">            <div class="paragraph__wysiwyg-text">
        <div class="content__wrapper">
    <div class="body-text  "><p>MSF provides medical care to anyone who needs it, regardless of race, religion, or political affiliation. As an organization, we focus on filling the greatest gaps in health care. &nbsp;</p>

<p>To facilitate our humanitarian and medical work, we speak to all parties to the conflict to request safe, rapid, and unimpeded access to civilians who require medical care and to ensure the safety and security of our staff. Our independence and impartiality are essential to our work in all the places we operate across the globe. We also believe that the principles of impartiality and neutrality are not synonymous with silence. When the world turns its back on crises, we are duty-bound to raise our voices and speak out on behalf of our patients. Our decision to do so is always guided by our mission to do no harm, preserve respect and dignity, and protect life and health. &nbsp;&nbsp;</p>

<h5><a href="https://www.doctorswithoutborders.org/your-questions-about-our-work-gaza-answered" title="Your questions about our work in Gaza, answered">Read more frequently asked questions about our work in Gaza &gt;&gt;&nbsp;</a></h5>

<h4>&nbsp;</h4></div>
</div>
      </div>
      </div>
  </div>
  </div>
</div>
  </div>
			</div>
</div>
              <div class="field__item">

      <div class="mbt__text-content">
                          <h2 class="heading-2 mbt__text-content__title">"It's hard for me not to cry"</h2>
                <div class="class">
          <p class="caption  caption-large mbt__text-content__desc">Nurse Karin Huster reflects on her three assignments in Gaza since the war started in 2023.</p>
        </div>
                  
<a class="link-item link-bold mbt__text-content__link link-icon--right-arrow" href="https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=AP3KrSnHmDg">Watch on YouTube</a>
              </div>
    </div>
  </div>

</div>
              <div class="field__item">
	
		
		
	
	<div class="paragraph paragraph--type--accordion paragraph--view-mode--default">
					
<div class="msf-accordion accordion-container content__wrapper">
      <h2 class="msf-accordion__heading">What MSF is calling for in Gaza</h2>
  
      <div class="ac ">
  <h3 class="ac-header">
    <button class="ac-trigger"><p>All parties must respect the ceasefire agreement</p></button>
      </h3>
  <div class="ac-panel">
    
    
  <div class="field field--name-field-accordion-content-block field--type-entity-reference-revisions field--label-hidden field__items">
        <div class="field__item">            <div class="paragraph__wysiwyg-text">
        <div class="content__wrapper">
    <div class="body-text  "><p>MSF calls on Israel, Hamas, and other groups and organizations in control of Gaza, to respect the <a href="https://www.doctorswithoutborders.org/latest/gaza-ceasefire-465-days-and-46000-lives-too-late" title="Gaza ceasefire: 465 days and 46,000 lives too late ">ceasefire</a> agreement, as well the safe and secure delivery of humanitarian assistance to people. MSF has been continuously calling for a sustained and immediate ceasefire in Gaza since November 2023 along with other humanitarian actors.&nbsp;</p></div>
</div>
      </div>
      </div>
  </div>
  </div>
</div>
      <div class="ac ">
  <h3 class="ac-header">
    <button class="ac-trigger"><p>A massive scale-up of humanitarian aid is urgently needed</p></button>
      </h3>
  <div class="ac-panel">
    
    
  <div class="field field--name-field-accordion-content-block field--type-entity-reference-revisions field--label-hidden field__items">
        <div class="field__item">            <div class="paragraph__wysiwyg-text">
        <div class="content__wrapper">
    <div class="body-text  "><p>Palestinians in Gaza need an immediate, massive scale-up of humanitarian response and unhindered access to aid. Israel’s obstruction must end, and Israeli authorities must ensure that humanitarian supplies can securely <a href="https://www.doctorswithoutborders.org/latest/impossible-task-getting-lifesaving-supplies-gaza" title="What it takes to get lifesaving supplies into Gaza">enter</a> Gaza to reach those in need, including people in the north of the Strip, where over half a million Palestinians have returned to homes reduced to ashes, razed hospitals, and continued lack of essential services including water and health care. &nbsp;</p><p>As the occupying power, Israeli authorities are responsible for ensuring rapid, unimpeded, and safe access to humanitarian aid at a level sufficient to meet people’s needs. MSF calls for all parties to ensure safe routes to move humanitarian assistance into and around the Gaza Strip and for aid to reach those in need, including people in the <a href="https://www.doctorswithoutborders.org/latest/north-gaza-health-system-has-been-reduced-ashes" title="In North Gaza, the health system has been reduced to ashes">north of Gaza</a>. Everyone should have access to vital goods, such as fuel, food, water and medicines.</p><p>MSF remains committed to responding in Gaza and adjusting the scale of our activities as the situation develops.&nbsp;</p></div>
</div>
      </div>
      </div>
  </div>
  </div>
</div>
      <div class="ac ">
  <h3 class="ac-header">
    <button class="ac-trigger"><p>Medical evacuations must be facilitated without prejudice to Palestinians' right to return</p></button>
      </h3>
  <div class="ac-panel">
    
    
  <div class="field field--name-field-accordion-content-block field--type-entity-reference-revisions field--label-hidden field__items">
        <div class="field__item">            <div class="paragraph__wysiwyg-text">
        <div class="content__wrapper">
    <div class="body-text  "><p>Among more than 100,000 wounded people are thousands of patients requiring complex and sustained medical care that is not available in Gaza. MSF calls on Israeli authorities to protect the remaining health system in Gaza, as well as to ensure <a href="https://www.doctorswithoutborders.org/latest/long-road-recovery-gazas-war-wounded-children" title="The long road to recovery for Gaza’s war-wounded children">medical evacuations</a> for people in need of <a href="https://www.doctorswithoutborders.org/latest/longing-gaza-after-medical-evacuation-abdul-rahmans-story" title="Longing for Gaza after medical evacuation: Abdul Rahman’s story">lifesaving care</a> and their caregivers. All medical referrals, patients, and their caregivers must be guaranteed safe, voluntary, and dignified return to Gaza.&nbsp;</p></div>
</div>
      </div>
      </div>
  </div>
  </div>
</div>
  </div>
			</div>
</div>
